channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WFLY-1379] log4j appenders force initialization of the appender/handler on reboot
item.description:
Adding a log4j appender works until the server is rebooted. The difference in the class names, org.apache.log4j.SomeAppender and manually added org.jboss.as.logging.logmanager.Log4jAppenderHandler, results in the handler being reconfigured.

This also hits a bug (LOGMGR-58) in the logmanager where null references are can be retrieved before a full commit is invoked.

Stack trace:

item.summary: log4j appenders force initialization of the appender/handler on reboot

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
James Perkins <jperkins@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 971190

Description of problem:
Adding a log4j appender works until the server is rebooted. The difference in the class names, org.apache.log4j.SomeAppender and manually added org.jboss.as.logging.logmanager.Log4jAppenderHandler, results in the handler being reconfigured.
This also hits a bug (LOGMGR-58) in the logmanager where null references are can be retrieved before a full commit is invoked.

Steps to Reproduce:
Add a custom handler that is a log4j appender and define at least one property.
James Perkins <jperkins@redhat.com> changed the Status of bug 971190 from NEW to POST
Kyle Lape <klape@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 971618
Carlo de Wolf <cdewolf@redhat.com> changed the Status of bug 971190 from POST to ASSIGNED

Carlo de Wolf <cdewolf@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 971190

Pending resolution of https://issues.jboss.org/browse/WFLY-1503
James Perkins <jperkins@redhat.com> changed the Status of bug 971190 from ASSIGNED to POST

pkremens@redhat.com made a comment on bug 971190

Verified on EAP 6.1.1 ER4
pkremens@redhat.com changed the Status of bug 971190 from ON_QA to VERIFIED
